intro: Veronica orchidea subsp. transcaucasica, commonly known as the Transcaucasian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branched. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
